alert.note: Alert for Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 11:11AM EST until January 14 at 11:45AM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southwestern Essex County in northern New York... * Until 1145 AM EST. * At 1108 AM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Newcomb to 38 miles southwest of Vanderwhacker Mountain, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Roads impacted include Route 28N and Highway 84. Locations impacted include... Minerva, Newcomb, Olmstedville, and Vanderwhacker Mountain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
